thread.section_title: South Florida Sports News - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Dwyer star QB Centeio out Friday after hospital stay
thread.title_full: Dwyer star QB Centeio out Friday after hospital stay - Sun Sentinel

author: Patrick Maks, Pat Lammer
title: Dwyer star QB Centeio out Friday after hospital stay
text:
Todd Centeio will remain absent from Dwyer’s gameday roster for Friday’s key district game at Royal Palm Beach as the Panthers’ star quarterback has not been cleared by doctors to return to play.
Centeio hasn’t played since Sept. 25 because of an undisclosed condition, missing Dwyer’s homecoming victory against Olympic Heights on Oct. 2 and last week’s road win over Wellington.
The three-star pro-style quarterback was hospitalized last week, Dwyer coach Jack Daniels said Thursday at practice.
“He had like flu-like symptoms, lost some weight, was running a big fever,” Daniels said. “He was in there last Friday and we went by [the hospital] and saw him before the game, and it was a pretty emotional thing.”
Daniels said he expects Centeio to return soon — but not soon enough to take the field Friday as Dwyer (6-0, 2-0) travels to Royal Palm Beach (3-3, 2-0) to battle for the top spot in District 13-7A.
“He needs to get his strength back, but he's back with us. We can't wait to get him back,” Daniels said, noting Centeio was already back in school. “I expect him hopefully to be practicing Monday.”
Centeio, who attended Thursday’s practice, but did not participate, told the Sun Sentinel, “I’ll be back soon.”
Prior to last week’s game, senior receiver Isaiah Johnson, who has been Centeio’s top target, set aside his jersey No. 21 and instead wore Centeio’s No. 16 as a tribute. And over the past several days, Dwyer players and well-wishers expressed concern and posted get-well messages to Centeio’s Twitter timeline.
“Waking up praying that my brother will be dismissed from the hospital soon healthy and strong. Miss my dawg man @toddycenteio,” junior linebacker Javen DiCocco wrote Saturday.
Junior receiver Levon Barnett, after Dwyer beat Wellington 42-35, tweeted: “Did it for bro tonight @toddycenteio.”
“Feel better toddy we did it for you today get well soon,” junior lineman Javaun Thomas added.
In the meantime, Class 7A’s top-ranked team has turned to another junior — Eli Mathews — to start at QB in Centeio's absence. Mathews is 17-for-22 passing, for 400 yards and five touchdowns in his first two games, according to Daniels.
“We are fortunate to have a backup as good as he is,” Daniels said.
Centeio, who transferred from Royal Palm in January, is regarded as one of the area’s top quarterbacks. A one-time Miami commit, he has thrown for eight touchdowns this season.
Correspondent Gary Curreri contributed to this report.
